intro: Guettardella paxillata, commonly known as the pink fairy fan, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
